text: I just did a quick test using the SeeSay code base, and it looks like we can have a custom sized surfaceview with the camera preview on top of a webview
there still might be some unknown bugs, but it appears that the camera1 API supports it without crashing the view hierarchy
(sorry I apparently had my laptop in DND mode)
<@U030TQFR3> I commented on all the relevant slides in the design presentation

<!channel>: 
Just got off a quick update call w/ Andy...
- He will be in town next week, planning to visit the office on Tuesday and/or Wednesday.
- He'd like to bring his designer with him. That means that they'd finish out the PSD blowouts here, in person, and we'd work directly with them. 
- Andy would like some master doc (that maps out the application, scale of functionality, permissions info, etc) that he can share with his Google client, and they in turn can share with other internal folks. <@U026PHQ3J> did we create any architecture document for the last google project? Maybe we follow the lead of what worked last time?
Not certain, but <@U030TQFR3> I will probably be up in Seattle for Koru Tues/Wed so hopefully that's ok
Tricky tricky. Okay! We will figure this out.
<@U030TQFR3> Meant to mention this earlier but I'll be there in the office all week next week —flu-free and all— if there's still anything I can help with in this project.
<@U030TQFR3> jk! i'll be here Tuesday but not Wednesday
<@U0260V1BX>: Boom. Yes Tues, no Weds. Got it!
